captions.text:
>> Jon: WELCOME TO "THE DAILY
SHOW."
I'M JON STEWART.

WE HAVE A VERY, VERY GOOD SHOW
TONIGHT.

MY GUEST TONIGHT, HOWARD SCHULTZ
WILL BE HERE.
HE'S THE C.E.O. OF STARBUCKS.

ACTUALLY, HE'S JUST HERE TO USE
OUR BATHROOM, BUT I'M MAKING HIM
BUY SOMETHING.
CONGRATULATIONS TO THE U.S.
WE BEAT GHANA 6-0.
[CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]
[AUDIENCE CHANTING U-S-A!]
>> Jon: HOLD ON A SECOND.

I ACTUALLY DON'T KNOW WHAT THE
SCORE WAS.

THEY'RE ACTUALLY, THEY'RE
PLAYING RIGHT NOW.

I WAS JUST TRYING TO BE
OPTIMISTIC.

BUT, LET'S START TONIGHT WITH
OUR CONTINUING COVERAGE OF
MESS 'O POTAMIA.

AS YOU KNOW, WE WENT INTO IRAQ
FOR ONE REASON AND FOR ONE
REASON ONLY.

>> THAT'S WHAT THIS FIGHT IS
ABOUT IN THIS PART OF THE WORLD,
PLANTING THE SEEDS OF DEMOCRACY.

>> THAT SEED OF DEMOCRACY IN
IRAQ.

>> Jon: IT WASN'T ABOUT
WEAPONS OF MASS DESTRUCTION OR

[LAUGHTER]
ONCE THOSE REASONS WERE FOUND TO
BE UNSUPPORTED BY REALITY.
IT WAS ABOUT AMERICA.

IT WAS ABOUT WHAT HAPPENS WHEN
ONE COUNTRY LOVES ANOTHER
COUNTRY VERY MUCH.

[LAUGHTER]
AND THAT COUNTRY THEN DEPOSITS

HIS DEMOCRACY SEED, TYPICALLY
LASER GUIDED, INTO ANOTHER

COUNTRY'S, LET'S SAY,
FERTILE CRESCENT.
BY THE WAY, IF YOU THINK...

[CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]
IF YOU THINK THE SEEDING OF

DEMOCRACY METAPHOR IS SLIGHTLY
MORE TORTURED THAN MANY OF THE

PEOPLE WE BROUGHT THAT DEMOCRACY
TO, YOU AIN'T SEEN NOTHING YET.

>> THE SEEDS OF FREEDOM HAVE
ONLY RECENTLY BEEN PLANTED IN

IRAQ, BUT DEMOCRACY, WHEN IT
GROWS, IS NOT A FRAGILE FLOWER.
IT IS A HEALTHY, STURDY TREE.

[LAUGHTER]
>> Jon: AND THAT TREE IS
FAMILY TREE.

IT'S FAMILY MAN, FOR NO MAN IS
AN ISLAND, EXCEPT FOR
THE ISLE OF MAN.
WHERE IS THAT?
YOU KNOW WHAT? [BLEEPED] IT.
I'M GONNA GO PAINT A CAT.

ANYWAY, THE POINT IS THIS: WE
SPREAD OUR SEED ALL OVER IRAQ

AND IT BLOOMED, BABY, UNTIL OLD
JOHNNY O'BAMMY CAME IN,

AND NOW YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT'S
GROWING THERE.

>> THE SEEDS OF 9/11 ARE BEING
PLANTED ALL OVER IRAQ AND SYRIA.
>> Jon: YOU SEE WHAT HAPPENED?

THEY DONE SWAPPED OUT OUR
DEMOCRACY SEEDS WITH THE SEEDS

YOU KNOW, I'M NOT EVEN SURE WHY
BURPEE'S EVEN SELLS THOSE 9/11
SEEDS. WHY WOULD THEY DO THAT?

THAT'S LIKE, SEEMS LIKE A
LAWSUIT WAITING TO HAPPEN.

[APPLAUSE]
IT'S LIKE WHEN THEY STOCKED ALL
THOSE VENUS DOG TRAPS.
IT'S JUST STUPID.

[LAUGHTER]
I'M GOING TO GO BEAGLE.

POINT IS ALL THAT GREAT STUFF WE
DID AFTER OBVIOUSLY SOME OF THE

BAD STUFF WE DID IS TOTALLY
UNDONE NOW BY THE ISLAMIC STATE

OF IRAQ AND SYRIA, WHO ARE
CURRENTLY SOWING CHAOS SEEDS.
SO NOW WHAT DO WE DO?

WELL, IF YOU REMEMBER IN
THE ORIGINAL RUSH TO WAR, I MEAN

DILIGENTLY PLANNED,
INTERNATIONALLY SANCTIONED

FREEDOM RAVE, THERE WERE SOME
INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE WRONG, UH,

ABOUT THE WHOLE [BLEEPED] THING,
JUST WRONG, JUST DEAD WRONG,

LIKE ABOUT EVERYTHING, ALL OF
THEM.

>> LET'S ACT NOW TO GET RID OF
A TYRANT WHO HAS ABUSED AND

KILLED HIS OWN PEOPLE,
WHO IS PROCURING WEAPONS

OF MASS DESTRUCTION, SUBSTANTIAL
EVIDENCE TO THAT EFFECT.

>> THE CHOICE IS DISARMING HIM
BY WAR OR LETTING HIM HAVE THESE
WEAPONS OF MASS DESTRUCTION.

>> YOU'RE DEALING WITH A COUNTRY
THAT CAN REALLY FINANCE ITS OWN

RECONSTRUCTION AND RELATIVELY
SOON.

>> THE BA'ATHISTS WHO USED THEIR
POWER TO REPRESS THE IRAQI

PEOPLE WILL BE
REMOVED FROM OFFICE.

>> Jon: BY THE WAY, YOU CAN HAVE
ALL THESE MEMORABLE SCREWUPS AND

MORE, JUST CALL NOW AND ORDER,
"NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL BEING

COMPLETELY BLEEP WRONG ABOUT
IRAQ."

[CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]
>> Jon: ANYHOW, SO, BUT

HERE'S WHAT HAPPENED, YOU'LL
APPRECIATE THIS.

I THINK YOU'LL APPRECIATE THIS,
THOSE IDIOTS WERE OSTRACIZED,

NEVER HEARD FROM AGAIN, BECAUSE
OF HOW -- I'M KIDDING.

BECAUSE I THINK WE ALL KNOW FOUR
WRONGS MAKE A RIGHT.

AND IN THIS CURRENT CRISIS, THE
NEWS MEDIA HAS CRUSHED TO GET
THE BAND BACK TOGETHER AGAIN.

AND THEY ALL HAVE THE SAME
ADVICE.

ON BASS... ICALLY WRONG ABOUT
EVERYTHING, BILL KRISTOL.

ON DRUM... MING UP SUPPORT FOR
ENDLESS WAR, PAUL WOLFOWITZ.

ON GUITAR YOU KIDDING ME, HOW
DOES THIS GUY KEEP GETTING

BOOKED ON TELEVISION, LINDSEY
GRAHAM.

>> THIS STUBBORN-HEADED
PRESIDENT WE HAVE WHO THINKS HE

KNOWS BETTER THAN EVERYBODY
ELSE, WHO WITHDREW TROOPS.

STUBBORN-HEADED, DELUSIONAL,
DETACHED PRESIDENT, BUT THAT'S

THE LAST BAD THING I'M GOING TO
SAY.

[LAUGHTER]
>> Jon: MY WICKED TONGUE.

[LAUGHTER]
[SPEAKING WITH SOUTHERN ACCENT]:
I'M SO BAD... AT FOREIGN POLICY.

NOW POUR ME ANOTHER JULEP.
LINDSEY FEELS A SONG.

>> Jon: BUT, LIKE ANY TERRIBLE
BAND, THEY'RE NOTHING WITHOUT

THEIR LEAD SINGER, OLD JOHNNY
ROTTEN.
JOHNNY ROTTEN JUDGMENT.

HIS ADVOCACY OF THE IRAQ WAR WAS
LEGEND, HIS SOPHISTICATED

KNOWLEDGE OF THE REGION
UNPARALLELED, IN THAT IT DID NOT

PARALLEL WITH ANYBODY WHO HAD
KNOWLEDGE OF THE REGION.

>> THERE IS NOT A HISTORY OF
CLASHES THAT ARE VIOLENT BETWEEN

SUNNIS AND SHIAS, SO I THINK
THEY CAN PROBABLY GET ALONG.

>> Jon: NOW, THAT IS A TRUE
STATEMENT IF YOU DON'T COUNT THE

LONG HISTORY OF VIOLENT CLASHES
BETWEEN SUNNI AND SHIITE.

AND HE'S RIGHT, THROUGHOUT
HISTORY THERE ARE LOTS OF

EXAMPLES OF SUNNIS AND SHIAS
PEACEFULLY SHARING POWER LIKE

WE WERE GOING TO HAVE
THEM DO IN IRAQ. LIKE, UM,

OKAY, HERE'S A GREAT ONE, BACK
IN THE 50s, 950, YEAH, THE

ONLY TIME IT'S EVER HAPPENED IS
OVER 1,000 YEARS AGO IN WHAT IS
NOW IRAN AND IRAQ.

THERE WAS A PRO-SHIITE WARLORD
DYNASTY SHARING POWER WITH A
PRO-SUNNI CALIPH.
YEAH, IN 950.

I DON'T KNOW WHY THEY COULDN'T
FIND THIS BOOK.

[LAUGHTER]
AND, SINCE JOHN McCAIN WAS ONE

OF THE WRONGEST BEFORE AND
DURING THE WAR, IT'S ONLY

FITTING THAT IN THIS CURRENT
CRISIS HE WAS ON SO MANY SHOWS

YOU'D THINK HE JUST WON "DANCING
WITH THE STARS."

[LAUGHTER]
>> A DECISION WAS MADE BY THE

OBAMA ADMINISTRATION TO NOT HAVE
A RESIDUAL FORCE IN IRAQ.

>> WE LEFT TROOPS BEHIND IN
KOREA, IN GERMANY, IN JAPAN,
EVEN IN BOSNIA.
THEY ARE STABLIZING FORCE.
WE HAD THE CONFLICT WON.
WE HAD THAT WAR WON.
AND WE BLEW IT.

>> Jon: AND ALL WE WOULD HAVE DO
MAINTAIN THE VICTORY IS STAY
THERE FOREVER.

IT'S LIKE WHEN YOU WIN AT A
CASINO.

AND TO GET THE MONEY, YOU HAVE
TO LIVE THERE.

WHY DID OBAMA SNATCH DEFEAT FROM
THE JAWS OF VICTORY?

>> PRESIDENT BUSH SIGNED A
TREATY AT THE END OF 2008 THE

STATUS OF FORCES AGREEMENT,
WHICH SAID THAT ALL U.S. FORCES,

NOT JUST COMBAT FORCES,
ALL U.S. FORCES, WILL BE OUT OF
IRAQ BY THE END OF 2011.
>> Jon: WHAT?

ONLY A SECRET MUSLIM KENYAN
TERRORIST VEGAN IS SHREWD ENOUGH

TO ENSURE OUR DEFEAT BEFORE HE
EVER TOOK OFFICE BY JEDI
MIND-TRICKING PATRIOT MAN.

ACTUALLY, FOR HIM YOU DON'T
ACTUALLY NEED TO USE THE JEDI
MIND TRICK.

YOU JUST KIND OF WAVE YOUR HAND
AND HE DOES WHATEVER...

ALTHOUGH, TO BE FAIR TO JOHN
McCAIN, IT'S NOT LIKE

THIS IS JUST HIS IRAQ STRATEGY.
HE IS CONSISTENT.

>> UKRAINE IS GOING TO NEED A
LONG-TERM MILITARY ASSISTANCE
PROGRAM FROM THE UNITED STATES.

>> QUOTE, "IF THEY KNEW WHERE
THEY WERE, I CERTAINLY WOULD

SEND IN U.S. TROOPS TO RESCUE
THEM, IN A NEW YORK MINUTE I
WOULD."
>> APPROPRIATE USE OF AIR POWER.
AIR STRIKES ON ASSAD'S FORCE.

>> YOU KNOW THAT OLD BEACH BOY
SONG "BOMB IRAN,"
BOMB-BOMB-BOMB, BOMB-BOMB IRAN.
ANYWAY...

>> Jon: HA! THE JOHN McCAIN
MILITARY VICTORY PLAN FOR

AMERICA IS THE SAME AS THE JOHN
MCCAIN MEDIA STRATEGY,
BE EVERYWHERE FOREVER.
WE'LL BE RIGHT BACK.

comments.author: Xevan

comments.text:
I swear to God so many of these pro-war politicians (not specifically 
conservatives) urge Americans to fight foreign wars against foreign enemies 
rather than worry about improving our own country within our borders. 

Young men my age are out there fighting the wars that old men started. Wars 
that these so-called "leaders" wouldn't even send their own children to. 
They expect thousands and thousands of this country's sons and daughters to 
sacrifice themselves just so these politicians can flex their muscles at 
other countries they view as inferior.

These people have honestly made honorable soldiers believe that they are 
defending their country when they are more than 10,000 miles away in a 
foreign land over reasons that have kept changing for decades. First it was 
WMD, then it was oil, then it was 9/11, and now it's because we think we're 
actually making a difference by destroying homes and displacing people?! 

Seriously these people need to re-think their policies if they think 
putting boots on the ground in every foreign situation is the answer. Just 
because a country doesn't fucking like us doesn't mean we should start 
deploying troops everywhere to make a point. I am very willing to defend my 
country and enlist WHEN MY COUNTRY IS ATTACKED, but I am not willing to lay 
down my life to invade a country and endanger innocent people just so some 
old politician can sit in his office and feel good about himself.﻿

comments.author: JuliusGeezer

comments.text:
What most overlook, though, is that Rummy, Cheney, Bush's daddy, etc.. were 
all in the Reagan whitehouse when the US was supporting and arming those 
cunts.  There was no great moral change or realization of the horrors going 
on.  Those horrors were known about.  Rummy had a friendly meeting with 
Saddam not long after the very massacre he was executed for 20 years 
later.  What changed was that Iraq finally became inconvenient, thus a war 
was arranged through April Glasspie which was the Gulf War.

There was no interest on the part of the Bush admin in creating democracy 
in Iraq.  They wanted to get rid of Saddam for personal and political 
reasons that had nothing to do with his history of torture and slaughter or 
his supposed weapons.  "planting the seeds of democracy" was just a vague 
way of sounding like they had a plan for what happened afterwards.

comments.text:
The problem with political comedy is that to be funny you have to 
generalize and exaggerate. Thats all fun if you're watching a comedy show 
but we have a huge problem when millions of young, gullible Americans turn 
to Jon Stewart to learn politics. WE're essentially creating a generation 
of idots who see complex issues in a black and white , simple manner.  ﻿
comments.author: JohnnyBoyCali

comments.text:
+Peter Beedle Yes you'll get 20 different predictions because some of those 
economists are idiots. You seem to think that having a degree automatically 
means you're a genius. I've worked as a computer programmer for over  a 
decade and have met tons of people with computer science degrees who were 
complete idiots. I've met people with math degrees that couldn't add or do 
basic arithmetic without a calculator. A truly intelligent person just 
talks articulately with facts and statistics to show he's right , he doesnt 
ramble about how many degrees he has.
comments.author: JohnnyBoyCali

comments.text:
+JohnnyBoyCali There is no point in us continuing this conversation any 
further. You obviously have trouble of what constitutes "facts". Once again 
your example is an over simplification. Economic is not an exact science, 
as they say, ask 10 economist to predict what increasing the minimum wage 
has on the economy and you'll get 20 predictions. But it seems you know the 
"truth" based on your "facts". Come back in 20 years when you've gained 
more knowledge of the world and able to communicate without being insulting.
comments.author: Peter Beedle

comments.text:
+Peter Beedle You're trying way too hard to sound smart. Yes there are 
facts and not just opinions. Its a fact for example that raising the 
minimum wage just causes the prices of everything to go up and you end up 
right back where you started.
comments.author: JohnnyBoyCali

comments.text:
My father was an educated wise old man, and CEO of a large company, I too 
have educated myself and was a Research Engineer/Scientist for 20 years and 
for more than 15 years been a Structural Engineer, and you will never hear 
a scientist use the word "fact". Everything is observational data, 
mathematical modelling and hypothesis, which is no more than educated 
opinions. The social sciences being the least scientific. So people like 
Bill O'Reilly are far from being qualified to tell the world what is fact, 
true, or right, because not only isn't he remotely qualified, there is not 
such thing as "facts, true, or right", only opinions. Anyone who thinks 
differently is ignorant, or is a conman and thinks you are ignorant.
comments.author: Peter Beedle

comments.text:
+Peter Beedle Your father is completely wrong. Many issues can simply 
addressed accurately using facts and statistics. That's why people do 
research and educate themselves.
comments.author: JohnnyBoyCali

comments.text:
+JohnnyBoyCali My father once told me to be very careful of people claiming 
to know the truth because they are usually dumb, ignorant and often 
dangerous to be around. I asked my Dad why, and he told me because there is 
no "truth" and "right or wrong". Truth is in the eyes of the beholder.
comments.author: Peter Beedle

comments.text:

comments.text:
Political satire has been around as long as politics and is an essential 
part of any democracy. It's multidimensional and only "black and white" if 
the viewer takes offence at the target of the satire. Since the 
introduction of partisan press by the Murdock empire young people only get 
a "black and white" view of politics anyway.
comments.author: Peter Beedle

comments.text:
+triburst Well then your part of the problem not the solution. Plus the 
parties meant nothing . So just blindly voting for independents is stupid. 
How about actually researching the candidates for who they are and what 
they've accomplished and vote for them. The problem is you think your vote 
doesnt count so your lazy and do nothing. You rather just blame others. If 
i dont like something I call and email my representatives and I vote at 
every election. Your just a whiner.
comments.author: JohnnyBoyCali

comments.text:
+JohnnyBoyCali I agree with you, party politics have taken over the entire 
system. I wont pretend I voted independent but until a tangible shift in 
the whole process happens it really is a wasted vote especially if you live 
in a hard red or blue state.
comments.author: triburst

comments.text:
+triburst There are many more parties than those two but people dont vote 
in the primaries and then they bitch and complain that during the elections 
there only left with 2 lame choices. Did you vote during every election? Do 
you research all the candidates, not just the main ones that are on TV? Do 
you email and call your representatives. No you dont do any of that , 
right? You just bitch and complain when it boils down to two people you 
dont like.
comments.author: JohnnyBoyCali

comments.text:

you'll get people saying the end times are around the corner unless we do 
something.

comments.author: Mustafa Bahrudin (must4fab)

comments.text:
You know what was funny though. I was in Iraq and even though our 
government invaded for no particularly good reason at all, most of the 
Iraqi civilians I met were happy to see us there. In throwing out Saddam 
Hussein we basically took out their own trash, saved them a violent 
revolution but in turn fucked them in the long run. People like to blame 
Obama for ISIS no, blame Bush because getting rid of Hussein is what turned 
Iraq into a failed state. We knew from day 0 that the US wasn't going to 
babysit that country forever. It's like we rescued a child from an abusive 
parent only to throw it out onto Skid Row. Saddam may have ruled with an 
iron fist but ISIS wouldn't have had the balls to fuck with him or his 
Republican Guard. They know as long as the US doesn't put boots back on the 
ground they basically have Iraq to themselves.﻿
comments.author: phillyslasher

comments.text: Yeah...you're right. I was there too.
comments.author: Doc Bino

comments.text:
+phillyslasher 
On the one hand sure, on the other hand, IS is fucking over Syria and doing 
a damn good job at it. They could have taken Iraq. Kurds probably would 
have helped, it would have turned into a shitstorm, but they could have 
easily taken Iraq.

And then it would have gone to hell again.

As much as McCain is a right wing nutcase, he's right about needing troops 
to stay in Iraq for a while. Ideally it would have been split up into 
regions where people got along with each other instead of by British/French 
arbitrary lines, with the Kurds having their own state, and Turkey told not 
to fuck with them, as that would have made it a bit better than "You! Now 
you're in the Iraqi army fighting for a country that hates you. Don't run 
when someone shoots at you".

help in anyway he could.  It just doesn't make sense that someone who was 
in the military can't comment on his personal experience.  The OP was 
actually pretty serious in tone so its not like he was being a comedian 
with the subject matter.  

You seem to be projecting your own anger with the military on this guy. 
 You seem like the kind of person that would protest at a soldier's funeral 
because they all deserve to go to hell.  Blame the politicians not the 
soldiers.

I was in Iraq in 06-07 and 2011 The whole time I was there I knew we 
shouldn't have been. Now I have been diagnosed with PTSD, suffered from the 
effects of that war and am now on disability for it. The Shiites and Sunnis 
don't get along. never have, never will. They both follow a false religion 
and kill each other over it. I do enjoy the Daily Show because it is funny 
and he makes great points using peoples own words against them. you can't 
argue with that.  I do believe the whole Iraq was was wrong and a huge 
mistake voted on by Congress of both parties and asked for by a President
